description:
Grosmannia clavigera kw1407 is a species of fungus that belongs to the genus Grosmannia. It is a filamentous ascomycete, meaning it reproduces through the formation of spores within specialized structures called asci.

Grosmannia clavigera kw1407 is known to be an important pathogen of pine trees, particularly in North America. It is the causative agent of a disease known as "mountain pine beetle blue stain," which is associated with the mountain pine beetle (Dendroctonus ponderosae) and can lead to the death of infected trees.

The fungus is believed to be transmitted by the mountain pine beetle, which acts as a vector, carrying the fungal spores from tree to tree. Once inside the host tree, the fungus colonizes the vascular system, disrupting the tree's ability to transport water and nutrients, ultimately leading to its demise.

Grosmannia clavigera kw1407 is of significant ecological and economic importance, as it can have a profound impact on forest ecosystems and the timber industry in regions where the mountain pine beetle and its associated fungal pathogens are present.
